Profile: Dr. Gourab Chatterjee. Role: Senior Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Gourab Chatterjee is Assistant Professor at the School of Liberal Studies, KIIT. With over 10 years of teaching and research experience, he holds a PhD from Jadavpur University. His expertise includes African and Indian Literatures, Literary Theory, and Cultural Studies. He has published extensively in national and international journals and edited volumes. A certified Swahili language user and translator, he also holds IPR for a rural handicrafts business model. He has presented at major international conferences and currently serves as Coordinator of the Centre for Cultural Studies and Comparative Literature and Faculty-in-Charge of International Relations. He is a life member of CLAI and an active member of ICLA.. Profile: Dr. Arpita Goswami. Role: Senior Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Arpita Goswami is an assistant professor in the School of Liberal Studies, KIIT deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha. Dr. Goswami obtained her PhD. from Tripura university in 2018. She cracked the National Eligibility Test (NET UGC) and the North East State Level Eligibility Test in English. She was awarded an ICSSR doctoral fellowship in 2013. She has presented research papers at numerous national and international conferences, seminars, and workshops and has published ten research papers in Scopus-indexed and other peer-reviewed journals. Her research interests include linguistics, English Language Teaching, folklore, feminism, and gender studies.. Profile: Dr. Arpita Nayak. Role: Assistant Professor I. Bio: Dr. Arpita Nayak is currently serving as an Assistant Professor, offering courses in management. She completed her Ph.D. in management from the KIIT School of Management. Her MBA and strong interest in Human Resource Management (HRM) led her to pursue further studies in HRM. Her passion for talent management inspired her doctoral research on “A Comparative Study on Talent Management in Private and Public Manufacturing Industries in Odisha.” Dr. Nayak has presented research papers at both national and international conferences and has published articles in SCOPUS-listed journals. Over the years, she has taught a variety of subjects, including Human Resource Management, Principles of Management, Business Studies Management, Tribal Entrepreneurship, and Organizational Behaviour. In addition to her academic career, she also has several years of corporate work experience.. Profile: Dr. Bignya Patnaik. Role: Senior Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Bignya Patnaik is an Assistant Professor teaching management courses. Her research focuses on diversity and equality management in higher education. She has presented at national and international conferences and published in SCOPUS-listed journals. Profile: Dr. Chaitali Choudhury. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Chaitali Choudhury is an Assistant Professor of English in the Department of Humanities, School of Liberal Studies, KIIT-DU. She completed her graduation and post-graduation from the University of Kalyani, West Bengal, and received her Ph.D. from National Institute of Technology Rourkela, Odisha. Her doctoral research focuses on ascetic ideals in Indian nationalist thought. Her research interests also include life writings, cultural studies, gender and religion.. Profile: Dr. Chetna Sinha. Role: Senior Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Chetna Sinha is presently working as Assistant Professor (II) in the Department of Humanities, KIIT School of Liberal Studies, in the KIIT University, Bhubaneshwar. She has an experience of over sixteen years in teaching and training in English Language, Literature, Communication & Soft Skills at various levels. She is a Ph.D. in English with Masters in ELT & Linguistics. She has also done her MBA in HRM. She is a certified Soft Skills & Body Language Trainer from IIT, Roorkee through NPTEL. She is also a certified trainer on Enhancing Soft Skills and Personality from IIT Kanpur. She has conducted many workshops and training programs for the entry and middle level executives. Her areas of interest include Soft Skills and Behavioral Training.. Profile: Dr. Debanjali Roy. Role: Senior Assistant Professor. She holds Master’s degrees in Management, Economics, and Yoga, a Ph.D. in Management, and has cleared NET in Management and Labour Welfare & IR. A university 2nd rank holder in MBA and college topper in MA (Yoga), her research interests include mental health, emotional intelligence, spirituality at work, leadership, and AI in business. Profile: Khushboo Kuddus. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Dr. Khushboo  is an Associate Professor in the Department of Humanities at the School of Liberal Studies, KIIT DU, Bhubaneswar. With over 11 years of academic experience, she has imparted knowledge across UG, PG, and PhD programs at esteemed institutions, including Amity University and the Central University of Jharkhand, Ranchi. She holds a PhD in English and a Master’s degree in English with a specialization in ELT and Linguistics. Further enhancing her pedagogical expertise, she obtained her PGCTE and PGDTE from EFL University, Hyderabad. Her research interests encompass ELT, CALL, ICALL, TELT, Applied Linguistics, Phonetics, and Phonology. Notably, her research in ICALL reflects her interdisciplinary approach to language learning and teaching. Dr. Khushboo has successfully supervised PhD research in CALL, TELT, and ELT. She has presented papers at numerous national and international conferences and has published several papers, proceedings, and book chapters of  repute in the fields of  CALL and ICALL. She has also delivered talks as an  Invited Speaker at  prestigious colleges and universities and has chaired sessions in several national and international conferences..
